long_desc.thetext:
Latest upstream release: 2.15
Current version in Fedora Rawhide: 2.14.1
URL: http://www.seamonkey-project.org/releases/

Please consult the package updates policy before you issue an update to a stable branch: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Updates_Policy

More information about the service that created this bug can be found at:
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Upstream_release_monitoring

Well,

I try to upgrade it, but it seems less stable than before...

Language addons are shown enabled (both clean install and upgrade), but actually disabled. You should perform "disable"/"enable" switch in the Addon manager to cause them to work.

It seems that there are more time delays on startup for some areas of appearing windows (comparing with 2.14.1). 200x200 transparent square on left-upper corner is noticed again (previously, it was on old slow computers only). When a java applet starts first time, some transparent area appear (with previous page fragment), which seems was not in 2.14.1

I disable the new feature of setting seamonkey as "default user browser" etc. It could lead to some mess...

Anybody, please test seamonkey-2.15 more carefully.

seamonkey-2.15-1.el6 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 6.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/seamonkey-2.15-1.el6

seamonkey-2.15-1.fc18 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 18.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/seamonkey-2.15-1.fc18

seamonkey-2.15-1.fc17 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 17.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/seamonkey-2.15-1.fc17
We need an update for F16 too, as it isn't EOL for another month.

seamonkey-2.15-1.fc16 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 16.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/seamonkey-2.15-1.fc16

Package seamonkey-2.15-1.el6:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=epel-testing seamonkey-2.15-1.el6'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2013-0110/seamonkey-2.15-1.el6
then log in and leave karma (feedback).
